title: Madānu Canal Gate
description: The Neo-Babylonian kings Nabopolassar (r. 625–605 BC) and Nebuchadnezzar II (r. 604–562 BC) constructed an outer wall around the eastern side of Babylon. That mudbrick wall is reported to have had 120 towers and 5 entrances, including the Madānu Canal Gate. This access point to the city was probably located on the eastern stretch of the wall.

properties.description: The proposed location of the gate is based on a plan of the ruins of Babylon, with 500 m UTM coordinates.
properties.title: Proposed location of the Madānu Canal Gate
